headline.main: It’s About More Than Food (1 Letter)

docs.lead_paragraph: Aspirin is a powerful blocker of a chemical called COX-2 that allows formation of a prostaglandin linked to inflammation and the development of tumors.

headline.seo: Aspirin May Prevent Cervical Cancer in Women With H.I.V.
headline.main: Research: Aspirin Shows Promise in Limiting Cancer for Women Who Have H.I.V., Scientists Say
headline.print_headline: Research: Aspirin May Limit Cancer for Women Who Have H.I.V., Scientists Say

docs.abstract: Study in journal Cancer Prevention Research reports that the virus that causes AIDS also drives up production of a prostaglandin called PGE2, which can cause inflammation in cervical tissue and is linked to the development of cervical tumors; because aspirin is a powerful blocker of a chemical that allows prostaglandins to be formed, research suggests that low-dose aspirin should be investigated for as a tool in preventing cervical cancer.
docs.snippet: Aspirin is a powerful blocker of a chemical called COX-2 that allows formation of a prostaglandin linked to inflammation and the development of tumors.

docs.lead_paragraph: Michel Sidibé, head of the United Nations AIDS program, won’t take no for an answer, colleagues say, as he presses governments in Africa and Asia to step up prevention efforts.

headline.seo: Charm Offensive Is U.N.AIDS Chief’s Strategy

docs.abstract: Profile of Michel Sidibe, executive director of the United Nations' AIDS prevention agency, who is using his African identity and personal charisma to push that continent's conservative nations into confronting AIDS with modern tactics.
docs.snippet: Michel Sidibé, head of the United Nations AIDS program, won’t take no for an answer, colleagues say, as he presses governments in Africa and Asia to step up prevention efforts.

docs.lead_paragraph: Chlamydia can lead to blindness and cause infertility in females, devastating a koala population already shrinking because of habitat loss, climate change and an AIDS-like immune disease.

headline.seo: Queensland Koalas Hit by Chlamydia Infections
headline.main: Squeezed Into Smaller Spaces, Koalas Now Face Deadly Disease
headline.print_headline: Squeezed Into Smaller Spaces, Koalas Now Face Deadly Disease

docs.abstract: Australia's koala population is under serious threat from Chlamydia, bacteria that can lead to blindness and cause infertility; koala populations are already shrinking because of habitat loss, climate change and an AIDS-like immune disease.
docs.snippet: Chlamydia can lead to blindness and cause infertility in females, devastating a koala population already shrinking because of habitat loss, climate change and an AIDS-like immune disease.

docs.lead_paragraph: New research supports a largely unrecognized culprit in circadian rhythm disturbances: the gradual yellowing of the lens and the narrowing of the pupil that come with age.

headline.seo: Aging of Eyes Is Blamed in Circadian Rhythm Disturbances
headline.main: Aging of Eyes Is Blamed for Range of Health Woes
headline.print_headline: Aging of Eyes Is Blamed for Range of Health Woes

docs.abstract: Several recent studies point to the aging of the eye as an unrecognized culprit in circadian rhythm disturbances, which can cause a range of health problems; as the eye ages, the lens gradually becomes more yellow, and the pupil narrows, allowing in less sunlight and causing the body to make errors in setting its internal clock.
docs.snippet: New research supports a largely unrecognized culprit in circadian rhythm disturbances: the gradual yellowing of the lens and the narrowing of the pupil that come with age.

docs.lead_paragraph: This dish focuses on hearty grains and assertive vegetables, so one chicken breast is all it takes to feed a family.

headline.seo: Bibimbap With Chicken, Broccoli Rabe, Mushrooms and Turnip — Recipes for Health
headline.main: Bibimbap With Chicken, Broccoli Rabe, Mushrooms and Turnip

docs.snippet: This dish focuses on hearty grains and assertive vegetables, so one chicken breast is all it takes to feed a family.

docs.lead_paragraph: A study has found that consumption of omega-3 fatty acids from fish is associated with a reduced risk for one kind of colon polyp, but only in women.

headline.seo: Fish Help Reduce Risk of One Kind of Colon Polyp in Women
headline.main: Prevention: Fish Helps Reduce Risk of Polyps in Women
headline.print_headline: Prevention: Fish Helps Reduce Risk of Polyps in Women

docs.abstract: Dr Harvey J Murff study in The American Journal of Clinical Nutrition finds that consumption of omega-3 fatty acids from fish is associated with a reduced risk for one kind of colon polyp in women.
docs.snippet: A study has found that consumption of omega-3 fatty acids from fish is associated with a reduced risk for one kind of colon polyp, but only in women.

docs.lead_paragraph: A new clinical trial found that a placebo worked just as well as the antibiotic amoxicillin in treating the runny nose, sneezing, cough, headache and other symptoms of sinusitis.

headline.seo: In Sinusitis, Antibiotics Are as Effective as Placebos, Study Finds
headline.main: Regimens: Antibiotic Use for Sinusitis Is Questioned
headline.print_headline: Regimens: Antibiotic Use for Sinusitis Is Questioned

docs.abstract: Dr Jane M Garbutt study in The Journal of the American Medical Association finds that a placebo works as well as antibiotics in treating sinusitis.
docs.snippet: A new clinical trial found that a placebo worked just as well as the antibiotic amoxicillin in treating the runny nose, sneezing, cough, headache and other symptoms of sinusitis.

keywords.value: Journal of the American Medical Assn
keywords.name: organizations

docs.lead_paragraph: A randomized study of 144 people put on low-calorie diets found that those given a high-carb, protein-rich breakfast with a dessert lost more weight and kept it off.

headline.seo: Dessert at Breakfast May Help Dieters
headline.main: Nutrition: Dessert at Breakfast May Help Dieters
headline.print_headline: Nutrition: Dessert at Breakfast May Help Dieters

docs.abstract: Dr Daniela Jakubowicz study in journal Steroids finds that a low-calorie meal plan that includes dessert with breakfast may help dieters lose additional weight.
docs.snippet: A randomized study of 144 people put on low-calorie diets found that those given a high-carb, protein-rich breakfast with a dessert lost more weight and kept it off.
